article.headline: Oklahoma 90, Oral Roberts 42
article.story:
OKLAHOMA CITY (AP) -- Oklahoma coach Sherri Coale was praising
"senior leadership" after the No. 21 Sooners beat Oral Roberts
90-42 Saturday in their season opener.

Senior guard Maria Villarroel had 20 points and senior forward
Caton Hill scored 17 to lead the team in the Bertha Teague Classic.
Oklahoma scored 17 straight points to open the second half.

Oral Roberts led by 4 in the first half on two occasions and the
game was tied at 16 when Oklahoma went on a 12-0 run to take the
lead for good.

Hill hit back-to-back 3-pointers to spark that rally, as the
Sooners went on to take a 35-23 lead at halftime. It was Hill's
first regular season appearance in almost a year after a knee
injury four games into the 2002-2003 season.

Hill also ignited the run after intermission, hitting another
three-point shot as Oklahoma pushed the lead to 54-23 just five
minutes into the second half.

Oral Roberts never got any closer than 30 points the rest of the
way. Coale said the early struggle was good for her team.

"We didn't start very well and when it was tied with about
seven minutes to go in the first half, we had to decide if we were
going to panic," Coale said. "We didn't and then we were able to
take ORU out of their rhythm offensively."

She said the team relaxed following Hill's run after half time.

"That's what senior leadership can do for you," Coale said.

Krista Sanchez added 13, all in the second half, for the
Sooners.

Elisha Turek led Oral Roberts with 9 points.

It was ORU's 16th consecutive loss to Oklahoma.

"This was probably the strongest OU team we have faced from top
to bottom," Oral Roberts coach Jerry Finkbeiner said. "They don't
have a star player, but they are definitely the strongest, most
physical team of all the Oklahoma teams we have played."

Twelve players scored for Oklahoma and the Sooners outrebounded
the Golden Eagles 68-23.

Oklahoma will return home to host Southeast Missouri State on
Monday. Oral Roberts faces Texas-Arlington in their home opener
Tuesday.
